alert.note: Alert for Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:03PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of central Hancock, southeastern Van Buren, Lee and Clark Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms along a line extending from near Croton to 9 miles south of Wayland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Fort Madison, Keokuk, Carthage, Kahoka, Nauvoo, Hamilton, Warsaw, West Point, Donnellson, Montrose, Wayland, Bowen, Bonaparte, Alexandria, Ferris, Franklin, Niota, St. Francisville, Adrian and New Boston. Rainfall amounts of one inch in fifteen minuties have been reported with these storms. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Illinois...southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri.
